3 3 treble_crochet in the next opening chain 1 ▪ 3 double_crochet in the next opening chain 1 close the round with 1 slip_stitch in the second chain from the beginning of the round see image 4 on the right 6 | work 1 single_crochet in every st from the previous round make 1 single_crochet 2 chain 1 single_crochet in the chain spaces in the three corners close the round with 1 slip_stitch in the first single_crochet and break the yarn 7 | make four more buntings in the same manner or as many as you wish 2 everyday birthday bunting | hanne clemens tassels 1 | to make the tassels take a piece of cardboard or the lid of a rectangular container that is about 10 cm 4 inches wide wind the yarn 8 times around the cardboard or lid cut the yarn and take the bundle of yarn carefully from the cardboard or lid see image 1 on the right 2 | cut a piece of yarn measuring about 20 cm 8 inches thread this through one of the corners of the bunting and thread a wooden bead onto the yarn thread one string of the yarn through the bundle you just created see image 2 on the right make a tight knot cut the loops of the bundle to create a tassel 3 | take some scrap yarn in a contrasting color and wrap a few times around the tassel tie a knot and use the darning needle to weave in the end of the yarn see image 3 on the right finishing the bunting 1 | the last step is to connect all buntings together ▪ chain 10 ▪ *take the first bunting and work a row of single_crochet on the top chain 10* ▪ repeat from * to * 4 times or until all of your buntings are connected 3 everyday birthday bunting
